conclusion: Car A enters from the lower-right, travelling roughly toward the upper-left.
Blocks in the car’s corridor, in order of distance, are the red row, then the green row.

Several groups of blocks of different colors are placed on a green surface.
Red blocks are closest to A, followed by green blocks, with blue, yellow, and orange blocks farther away.

premise: Car A enters from the lower-right, travelling roughly toward the upper-left. Blocks in the car’s corridor, in order of distance, are the red row, then the green row.
conclusion: Car A will first collide with the red row of blocks.

premise: Car A collides with the red row of blocks. The hit is close to head-on, so most of A’s forward momentum is transferred straight into the red cubes.
conclusion: Red cubes scatter slightly forward and sideways; A loses a large part of its speed and its front corner rides up a little on the block, turning the car’s heading a few degrees to the left.

premise: A’s heading turns a few degrees to the left after colliding with the red row of blocks.
conclusion: A’s new path intersects the nearer (right-hand) green cube.

premise: A’s new path intersects the nearer (right-hand) green cube. Impact speed is already reduced.
conclusion: The hit pushes the first green cube into the next two, but there is not enough energy to topple the whole line or to spin the car much further.

premise: Almost all of A’s kinetic energy has gone into the two collisions. Rolling resistance on the cloth quickly removes the little that is left.
conclusion: The car comes to rest within a few centimetres of the green row, between the scattered red pieces behind it and the still-standing blue/yellow/orange structures farther away.

premise: Blue, yellow, and orange blocks are farther away or off-line, and A stops short of them.
conclusion: Blue, yellow, and orange blocks are not contacted.

premise: Car A first collides with the red row of blocks, then (after a slight leftward deflection) with the front cube of the green row, and finally stops just in front of the green row.
conclusion: A will first collide with the red row of blocks, then (after a slight leftward deflection) with the front cube of the green row, and will finally stop just in front of the green row.
